concept.title: Opening a Socket Server connection: Tutorial
concept.shortdesc: This tutorial describes how an application can open and manage a connection to the Socket Server. Other Socket Server tutorials build upon this tutorial. The Socket Server is also known as ESock.

section.title: Connecting to the Socket Server
section.p: The RSocketServ class provides the Connect() function to create a session to the socket server.

section.title: Procedure
section.p: The steps to connect and then close a session with the Socket Server are:

li.p: Call one of the RSocketServ::Connect() functions.
Call Close to end the session with the Socket Server

section.title: Example
Further considerations
section.p: The RSocketServ::Connect() function allows optional extra information to be sent to the Socket Server to change the performance of the connection. Two optional parameters are available:

li.p: Message Slots - If the client application expects to keep a large number of requests open at the same time, then the client application can increase the message slots available to the connection.

Protocol Preference - If the client application will use the connection to interact with only one protocol, then this protocol should be specified. The Socket Server uses the preferred protocol to improve the efficiency of the messages between the client application and the protocol

section.p: The RSocketServ connection allows a number of sub-connections that offer more functionality. The sub-connections available are:
The purpose of each of these sub-connections is described in the .
The procedure to attach any of these sub-connections is:

li.p: Create or use an existing RSocketServ session.
Call the Open() function on the object for the sub-connection class. Pass into the Open() function a reference to the RSocketServ session.
Call Close to end the sub-session

section.p: This example shows that you do not need to close sub-connections explicitly. If you close the RSocketServ connection, the Comms Framework closes all attached sub-connections.
